title: Liverpool v Arsenal betting odds: Changes will decide game
text:
Liverpool and Arsenal go head to head for the second time this season with a place in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals up for grabs

Team selection will be key

Liverpool are storming ahead at the top of the league but were shaken by Tottenham Hotspur on Sunday.

Harry Kane’s early goal had the Reds worried before they managed to turn the game around thanks to Jordan Henderson’s strike and a Mohamed Salah penalty.

Jurgen Klopp is likely to rest a host of his first-team regulars, which will make this game even more interesting.

Arsenal are likely to make some changes too but Paddy Power have them at 3/1 to get the away win.

The Gunners will also be encouraged by the fact Liverpool have lost their last two home matches in the Carabao Cup.

With the likes of Joel Matip injured and Virgil Van Dijk set to be left out, the Arsenal attack will fancy their chances of getting some goals, with both teams to score in both halves at 8/1.

Oxlade-Chamberlain back to haunt Gunners

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is set to start against his former side on Wednesday night.

The England midfielder swapped Arsenal for Anfield in 2017 but has had his development held back by injury.

Oxlade-Chamberlain is now fit and raring to go and this match provides a perfect opportunity for him to get back among the goals and give Jurgen Klopp a selection headache.

The Ox is 7/2 to score anytime with Paddy Power.

Liverpool winning streak a worry

Despite making changes, Klopp’s team are still massive favourites going into this game.

Paddy Power have them at 8/11 to win and 2/5 to qualify which would make it 10 games unbeaten against Arsenal at Anfield.

The Reds have won five of those 10, including a 3-1 victory in August, and Paddy Power have them at 11/1 to repeat the feat.

Liverpool are also enjoying a 14-match winning streak at home in all competitions and have scored in 19 of their past 20 matches.

If the Reds are in the mood you can be assured there will be goals and you can get Over 3.5 Goals at 5/4.

Martinelli can make the difference

Gabriel Martinelli has been a revelation for Arsenal since joining in the summer.

The Brazilian was unknown to many fans but has impressed with goals in the Europa League and Carabao Cup.

He has five in six appearances and there are odds of 11/2 on him to score in 90 minutes and Arsenal to win the match on Paddy Power.

The 18-year-old netted twice in the games against Nottingham Forest and Standard Liege and Paddy Power have him at 14/1 to score two or more again.
description: Betting preview as Liverpool and Arsenal go head-to-head for the second time this season with a place in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals up for grabs.
